repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
**Problem:** Some weird languages have different comment syntax depending on the location in the code, and we do not have a way to determine the correct `commentstring` for these special cases.

**Solution:** Allow queries to specify `commentstring` values in metadata, allowing users/`nvim-treesitter` to provide a better commenting experience without hugely increasing the scope of the code in core.

Fixes [#28830](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/28830)

comment_data.body: As this doesn't depend on `ft`, I think it can be moved outside of the `for` cycle.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -39,6 +77,11 @@ local function get_commentstring(ref_position)
       if cur_cs ~= '' and level > res_level then
         ts_cs = cur_cs
       end
+
+      local metadata_cs = get_metadata_commentstring(lang_tree, row, col)
+      if metadata_cs and level > res_level then
+        ts_cs = metadata_cs
+      end

comment_data.body:
All this tree-sitter magic is above my head, so can't really provide much useful feedback here.

One thing I'd expect is that all the tree-sitter routing might be a good candidate (or already is) for some `vim.treesitter` function. Can one of `vim.treesitter.get_captures_at_pos()` or `vim.treesitter.get_node()` be used here somehow?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -3,6 +3,44 @@
 ---@field left string Left part of comment
 ---@field right string Right part of comment
 
+---@param parser vim.treesitter.LanguageTree
+---@param row integer
+---@param col integer
+---@return string?
+local function get_metadata_commentstring(parser, row, col)
+  local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()
+  local highlighter = vim.treesitter.highlighter.active[bufnr]
+  if not highlighter then
+    return
+  end
+  local query = highlighter:get_query(parser:lang()):query()
+  if not query then
+    return
+  end
+  local range = { row, col, row, col }
+  local tree = assert(parser:tree_for_range(range))
+  local last_node = tree:root()
+  ---@type string?
+  local commentstring
+  for _, match, metadata in query:iter_matches(tree:root(), bufnr, row, row + 1) do

comment_data.body: Nice thanks! `get_captures_at_pos()` worked perfectly- note to self, update `_get_urls()` to use the same...

comment_data.body:
I think the whole approach can be made simpler by making the "get 'commentstring' from metdata" step directly inside the `get_commentstring()`. Here is the diff:

```diff
diff --git a/runtime/lua/vim/_comment.lua b/runtime/lua/vim/_comment.lua
index ef19793e04..db2fcea0ae 100644
--- a/runtime/lua/vim/_comment.lua
+++ b/runtime/lua/vim/_comment.lua
@@ -3,29 +3,6 @@
 ---@field left string Left part of comment
 ---@field right string Right part of comment
 
----@param row integer
----@param col integer
----@return string?
-local function get_metadata_commentstring(row, col)
-  local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_get_current_buf()
-  local caps = vim.treesitter.get_captures_at_pos(bufnr, row, col)
-  for i = #caps, 1, -1 do
-    local metadata = caps[i].metadata
-    local cms = metadata.commentstring
-    if not cms then
-      for _, value in pairs(metadata) do
-        if value.commentstring then
-          cms = value.commentstring
-          break
-        end
-      end
-    end
-    if cms then
-      return cms
-    end
-  end
-end
-
 --- Get 'commentstring' at cursor
 ---@param ref_position integer[]
 ---@return string
@@ -42,6 +19,21 @@ local function get_commentstring(ref_position)
   local row, col = ref_position[1] - 1, ref_position[2]
   local ref_range = { row, col, row, col + 1 }
 
+  -- - Get 'commentstring' from tree-sitter capture's metadata.
+  --   Traverse backwards to prefer "more narrow" capture.
+  local caps = vim.treesitter.get_captures_at_pos(0, row, col)
+  for i = #caps, 1, -1 do
+    local metadata = caps[i].metadata
+    if metadata.commentstring then
+      return metadata.commentstring
+    end
+    for _, value in pairs(metadata) do
+      if value.commentstring then
+        return value.commentstring
+      end
+    end
+  end
+
   -- - Get 'commentstring' from the deepest LanguageTree which both contains
   --   reference range and has valid 'commentstring' (meaning it has at least
   --   one associated 'filetype' with valid 'commentstring').
@@ -57,16 +49,10 @@ local function get_commentstring(ref_position)
 
     local lang = lang_tree:lang()
     local filetypes = vim.treesitter.language.get_filetypes(lang)
-
-    local metadata_cs = get_metadata_commentstring(row, col)
-    if metadata_cs and level > res_level then
-      ts_cs = metadata_cs
-    else
-      for _, ft in ipairs(filetypes) do
-        local cur_cs = vim.filetype.get_option(ft, 'commentstring')
-        if cur_cs ~= '' and level > res_level then
-          ts_cs = cur_cs
-        end
+    for _, ft in ipairs(filetypes) do
+      local cur_cs = vim.filetype.get_option(ft, 'commentstring')
+      if cur_cs ~= '' and level > res_level then
+        ts_cs = cur_cs
       end
     end
```

It basically moves (simplified version) of the approach inside `get_commentstring()` to be done *before* trying to get `'commentstring'` as languages-filetype option. Tests pass with this approach.

comment_data.body:
I personally prefer to avoid using specific languages when documenting language-agnostic functionality in favor of something like "take a look at the queries at this link".

But documentation is something where @clason has more authority.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -647,6 +647,18 @@ attribute: >query
     ((super_important_node) @superimportant (#set! priority 105))
 <
 
+                                               *treesitter-highlight-commentstring*
+Treesitter highlighting supports finer-grained 'commentstring's, used by the
+built-in |commenting| plugin. When the cursor is within a node with the
+`commentstring` metadata property set, the comment marker will be set to that
+string. This is useful for languages like `JSX` that have different comment

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
built-in |commenting| plugin. When the cursor is within a node that sets the
`commentstring` metadata property (|treesitter-directive-set!|), that property
defines the comment delimiter (where "innermost wins").
```

comment_regular_data.body: I was wondering the same.  Maybe in `treesitter.txt` in a similar section under `*treesitter-highlight-priority*`? There are a few sections in there related to special metadata stuff

I don't think this should be specific to `commentstring`, at least at the underlying function level (it's ok at the metadata level for now, unless we can think of a way to generalize this too). Can't this support any `vim.filetype.get_option`?

Sorry, I don't really understand what this would look like. Are you just saying to modify the helper function the be able to extract any option (not just commentstring)? Also when would it be helpful/make sense to set a different option in the metadata?

Hypothetically, what other options could this potentially be useful for? Are there any options like `commentstring` where the option may be different line by line?

Some ideas:
- `expandtab` in Makefiles? Recipe lines should have hard tabs, whereas variable logic ~should~ can be indented with spaces.
- `'breakat'` (though this is a global option)
- `'equalprg'`
- `'formatprj'`, `'formatexpr'`
- `'indentexpr'`
- `'iskeyword'`
- `'filetype'`?

Though I'd imagine in practice most of these would be handled via injections instead of this.

@ribru17, is traversing the output of `vim.treesitter.get_captures_at_pos()` backwards enough to guarantee that the "most narrow" capture is used? Because skipping manual traversing for this step is a big win. Could you, please, add a test for how it works with separate "conflicting" captures (because right now it looks like traverse forward would also pass the tests).

And if the current implementation is good from tree-sitter POV, it can be visibly simplified. I'll test and post suggestions tomorrow.

> @ribru17, is traversing the output of `vim.treesitter.get_captures_at_pos()` backwards enough to guarantee that the "most narrow" capture is used?

I am 99% sure it is, though I don't know if we have a test for `get_captures_at_pos()` ensuring this. That said I've added a test for the inner metadata logic, so I think all functionality is tested now
As for the generic helper function, it sorta depends on another PR I will put out soon (which depends on #30514, due to a small conflict)

> I don't think this should be specific to `commentstring`, at least at the underlying function level (it's ok at the metadata level for now, unless we can think of a way to generalize this too). Can't this support any `vim.filetype.get_option`?

@clason this PR may have changed since your comment, but is this still an open question / blocker? Does the "generalize `_get_urls`" TODO capture your suggestion?

> Hypothetically, what other options could this potentially be useful for? Are there any options like `commentstring` where the option may be different line by line

@lewis6991 are you suggesting something like:

    ((list) @_list (#set! @_list option.foo "..."))

or something else?

Yeah something like that. Clason suggested making this more generic, so I was just going through the thought process of any hypothetical benefits if we were to do that. The fact this is done using the `#set!` directive means we don't need any upstream support or community alignment to implement this.
Yes, I think it should be generic on the level of the queries/metadata, but I have been convinced that it makes sense for the actual feature/Lua implementation to be specific to `commentstring`.
Idea: Use `bo.foo` or `wo.foo` for symmetry with the Lua API (aids discoverability and reinforces domain knowledge)?
Would this look like using `wo.foo` as a table key or creating a `wo` table within metadata, then using `foo` for its key?

I didn't envision any table handling (yet; that can come later under the hood if that makes things easier); I was thinking merely as a namespace (alternative to `options.commentstring` -> `bo.commentstring`).
Is it possible to add this to the 0.11 milestone?
If it's done before 0.11 is released (which doesn't look imminent), it'll be included. I don't think it needs to block the release (which is what the milestone is for).

> If it's done before 0.11 is released (which doesn't look imminent), it'll be included. I don't think it needs to block the release (which is what the milestone is for).

Is there anything left to do here?

title: feat(comment): allow commentstring to be determined from node metadata
